block.p: GENERAL MOTORS CORP., Detroit, said its Saturn division would lay off 490 workers -- about 20 percent of the unionized work force -- from its assembly plant in Wilmington, Del., because of poor sales of its new L Series midsize sedan and wagon.

UNITEDAUTO GROUP INC., Detroit, one of the largest publicly held United States automobile dealers, bought five dealerships with combined annual revenue of $100 million for an undisclosed amount, letting the company expand into Cleveland.
